Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide family (Caerin subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.26026377]Virus:HIV:inhibition of HIV Pseudovirus (PsV) infection in CD4+ T cells(IC50=2.5 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: [Ref.26026377]Human endocervical cells End1/E6E7:50% cell death at 12.5 µM.
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial peptide, that adopts an alpha helical conformation which can disrupt bacterial membranes. Each caerin displays a different antimicrobial specificity.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed by the skin dorsal glands.
Sequence Information.Domain: Contains two amphipathic alpha helix regions separated by a region of less-defined helicity and greater flexibility By similarity.

Literature.Title: Inhibition of HIV infection by caerin 1 antimicrobial peptides.
Literature.Author: VanCompernolle S, Smith PB, Bowie JH, Tyler MJ, Unutmaz D, Rollins-Smith LA.
